Bumper Year for Student-Led Teaching Awards

It has been a bumper year for the Student-Led Teaching Awards in 2016-17, with over 200 nominations received for more than 50 members of staff.

The awards are completely student led, with all nominations coming from students and the decision panels who make the awards are made up of Student Reps and the Students' Union Education Officers.

We were thrilled with the level of detail and passion coming through the nominations, with real insights offered into the dedicated and creative work around the University to support the teaching and learning experience of undergraduate and postgraduate taught students.

Savannah, Undergraduate Education Officer, has this to say about the success and importance of the awards: 

I think the Student Led Teaching Awards are a great chance for students to express how much they enjoy their lecturers and highlight all the great teaching that goes on at Sussex. Being on the panel is a very fun part of my job as UG Education Officer, because I get to hear about the good stuff that's going on. It makes nice a change from fighting the many negative issues within the university. It reminds me how much I love Sussex students and staff.

The Students' Union is running a Student-Led Supeverisor Awards in collaboration with Doctoral School. Nominations will be open soon, so keep your eyes peeled for further information. 

All 55 winners of Student-Led Teaching Awards in 2016-17 will be invited to receive their certificate at a presentation ceremony at the end of the Annual Teaching and Learning Conference on 5 April.

 

The winners of 2016-17 Student-Led Teaching Awards by cluster and school/department are:
